news.summary: Shares of private-fund managers fell sharply Tuesday on concerns that the advent of artificial intelligence will tank their investments in software companies.  Ares Management and Blue Owl Capital shares dropped more than 9%, while Apollo Global Management and KKR fell more than 7% and Blackstone lost over 5%.  The moves follow a steep selloff in public stocks and debt of software companies that some analysts fear will become obsolete as more companies turn to AI for their technology needs.

news.summary: Shares of private-fund managers fell sharply Tuesday on concerns that the advent of artificial intelligence will tank their investments in software companies.  Ares Management and Blue Owl Capital shares dropped more than 9%, while Apollo Global Management and KKR fell more than 7% and Blackstone lost over 5%.  The moves follow a steep selloff in public stocks and debt of software companies that some analysts fear will become obsolete as more companies turn to AI for their technology needs.

news.headline: HP CEO Enrique Lores reveals why he is leaving to be the CEO of PayPal
news.article_text:
PayPal (PYPL) said on Tuesday that its chair, Enrique Lores, will take over as CEO of the payments services company on March 1.

Lores has been the CEO of computer and printer giant HP (HPQ) for six years. He will replace Alex Chriss as CEO of PayPal, the company said alongside the release of its fourth quarter earnings report.

news.headline: Five9, Rapid7, Shopify, ZoomInfo, and SentinelOne Shares Are Falling, What You Need To Know
news.article_text:
What Happened?

A number of stocks fell in the morning session after a broad sell-off swept through the software sector, driven by growing concerns about the impact of artificial intelligence. This led to institutional repositioning as traders pivot away from traditional SaaS providers in favor of companies with more defensible, AI-integrated moats. The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite index declined by 0.8%, while the broader S&P 500 also slipped.

news.article_text: Struggling PayPal Holdings (PYPL) on Tuesday announced a leadership change, bringing in Enrique Lores as its new president and chief executive. news.headline: PayPal (PYPL) Faces Analyst Downgrades Amid Rising Competition and Slower Checkout Growth
news.article_text:
PayPal Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL) is one of the best cheap stocks to buy for 2026. On January 28, Rothschild Redburn analyst Dominic Ball downgraded PayPal Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:PYPL) from Neutral to Sell and slashed the price target from $70 to $50. Ball cited the increasing competitive advantage of traditional card networks as a primary reason for the pessimistic shift toward the digital payments giant.
